theory.introduction: You can join, repeat, and format strings in Python using operators and methods.
theory.explanation: Use `+` to concatenate, `*` to repeat, and `f-strings` or `.format()` to inject variables into text. String formatting improves readability and customization of printed output.
keyPoints: Use `f"..."` to embed variables inside strings
Avoid mixing strings and numbers directly ‚Äî convert types or use formatting
